comments.text: I stood on the ramp that led toward the main road.
I got a quick ride to Phitsanulok. I hitched from the ramp onto the motorway with a sign in Thai and English below Phitsanulok. I used the vertical wave gesture. Good spot for getting north
You can come here with white bus from Chang Phuak Bus Station, price is 40 baht. Spot is good,there is a space for cars to stop, we cought ride to Pai in about 5 min
I stood right next to the sign that says pai. Didn't even put my bag down before I was picked up by a Thai family in a pickup truck
Good spot, a guy took me to the main road when I told him I was trying to get to Bangkok
good spot to get a ride to the big junction a few km ahead

Pretty good spot, hid in the shade of a signpost. Lots of space for cars to stop. Trucks too. Had 6 people stop, ask if I was ok, and offer to take me to the bus station. Difference between Thailand and Cambodia was very obvious.

Right after the intersection, great spot for going north. Cars go slower after the lights and there is heaps of space for pulling up. I stayed a bit after the abandoned police station. Got a ride to Chiang Mai with a sign in Thai in 20 minutes.There is another spot on the hitchmap next to 7/11 but if you hitch during the day this spot after the intersection is much better.
Good spot for going north. Right after intersection there is heaps of space to pull up. Cars will be going slower after the red light. Great spot for hitching to Chiang Mai
Very nice traffic light, 145 seconds of red light vs 54 seconds of green light, a lot of traffic.
This guy goes through everyday and picks every hitcher. But from my understanding Thai ppl donuts have problems picking us so it should be easy. Take the nearby metro here and walk to this spot

Leaving Bangkok
Take the local old-style bus 68-REG from Bang Lamphu to Samut Sakhon for 28 baht. Pay attention and ask the driver, as there's another bus n. 68 driving within the city. It took 90 minutes on Sunday 1pm, while Maps suggests 180 minutes in weekdays.
Don't get off at the intercity vans stop close to pier and trains, where most passenger go. (You can see the highway from that bus stop) Wait for the local bus terminal. Walk 5 minutes to the last entrance into the highway. Cars leav

The perfect place to hitchhike to Chiang Mai because the road goes straight there. There is a gas station and a 7/11 so cars go slow and there are plenty of places to stop. I started at 7:30am and within 5-6 minutes I was picked up by a car

Legit less than a minute and a Ute pulled over and I jumped in the back. Not the most shade but probably the best spot going south from Hat Yai. (Also the two lads that were there on the same day I was, shoot me a message, the last guy I was with got a photo of you Insta@kjmurrag1230)

In the morning there‚Äôs shade from a big billboard. Close lanes are moving slow. I stood just down from the petrol station, there is room for cars and maybe a medium truck to pull over. Bonus points for this spot it has a good spot out the back of the Amazon cafe you can sleep if you have a mat
Right now this junction is a construction site so cars go very slow.

Took a bus from Chiang Rai to the white temple.
From here its very easy to get south.

Good spot for hitching to Tak. Got a ride in 15min, standing with a sign written in Thai and English using the waving down a taxi gesture. I don‚Äôt know if there‚Äôs point in putting the spits out there since Thai people can pull up for you anywhere.
Got dropped here when hitching from Ayuthaya. I didn‚Äôt even yet get to the road to Sukhothai (12) to hitch from there where a car stopped and took me to Sukhothai.

Great spot. Traffic light, slow traffic for the turning intersection.

Used our Chiang Rai sign and thumbs up / hands down. Nearby shops and probably hotel in a pinch.

Previous ride dropped us here

If all the bus from Chiang Mai to Chiang Rai are full, walk from the bus station here. About 10min. We made a sign "Chiang Rai". Alternated thumbs up and hand down symbols. Got a ride 25min out of town. From there continued hitching and waited less than 5min each time.
Definitely have data on your phone for translate app!
Not much shade, steady traffic but not a lot. Got a ride pretty quickly and he was going nearly all the way to Bangkok but we stopped earlier to camp somewhere.

Under a tree with shade. Picked up by a very friendly couple. We offered to pay for the ferry, but they didn't want and it seems like they didn't pay for the us in their ticket price. They also bought a watermelon for us!
First scooter took me to Sritanu. Used 5km sign
First scooter took me to the pier. Used a 5km sign.
Direct ride to Trang and went out of their way to drop us off in town.
Scooter picked me up while I was walking beside the road.
No wait, a passing pickup truck asked me where I was going and dropped me off at the seatran ferry entrance.
Pickup truck picked me up after very little wait.
Lady took me to next 7/11. Be careful of drivers wanting money. But really good spot there

Started at PTT station right at the exit. 7.9858628, 99.1342286
Car took me to the Phuket/Surat Thani junction. Good spot but no shade at all.
5-10 minutes
5-10 minutes, got taken to next PTT
5-10 minutes
Lovely girl from Germany picked me up on her scooter, took me toy accommodation üëç
There's a gas station. Very easy to get a direct ride to Ranong.
Towards Surin and Nakhon Ratchasima. There is plenty of space to break, some cars are passing slowly after the turn, and you will be well visible.

We picked this road to get to Nakhon Ratchasima. We got a short ride towards Surin junction in maybe 10 minutes from here. Probably it would be easier and faster to get to highway number 24, which is 60km south.
Few people cross this border. However, we got a direct ride to Sisaket instantly with a Thai family who went to the border and back, just to buy some cheap alcohol or something.
Good spot, not too much shade, got picked up and dropped further down but is probably a really good spot to get a lift right down south

PTT gas station - This is one of the best spot in Bangkok to hitchhike south. I was going south, then I wrote a sign to Samut Songkhram (‡∏™‡∏°‡∏∏‡∏ó‡∏£‡∏™‡∏á‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏°) first, but the car only took me to Samut Sakhon (‡∏™‡∏°‡∏∏‡∏ó‡∏£‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏Ñ‡∏£), 10 km away.

You can get a cardboard from automobile shop at the end of gas station

** PTT station is the best gas station to hitch a ride in Thailand.
There's a bridge here now. Got a lift to Krabi. We had to pay 50 baht each to cross as passengers in the ferry.
Just before the ferry to Koh Lanta Noi you can wait or you can ask people while they waiting for the ferry to arrive.
Thais were really helpful but tried to bring me to a bus terminal because they don‚Äôt got it that I wanna hitchhike. Finally at a rest stop I a got a lift
Great spot to get to Pattaya and Koh Chang ferry

Just after the petrol station there is room for cars to kinda pull over, no shade, the far lane is normally moving fast but because people exit the petrol station the close lane is slow enough to flag down.

Kinda had some shade from a telegraph pole. I stood just down from the exit of the petrol station with a Chumphon sign. Super friendly staff there gave me water. The cars in the car lanes are booking it but the closer lanes are slow and easy to flag down
Good spot , lot of cars but many people se till going around . Sometimes many scooters beside the road don‚Äôt let drivers see you . But still a nice spot
Okayish spot, there are two food stalls with grilled entire chicken and one other stall. Space for cars to pull to the side. No shade.
Local scoter took me to PTT just out of town
Not the best Spot, cars on 2 lanes passing very fast.

Waited in the shade of a wooden patio. After one hour someone stopped but drove off after some miscommunication of where we wanted to go. We waited another hour before moving 500m up the road and got a lift within a few minutes.

There is a lot traffic passing through here, as well as some songthaewa to Ao Luek and some other longer distance buses you can stop. There were a few other people waiting here, so I think it may be a bus stop and that makes it confusing to hitchhike from here.
Okayish spot, little shade but only if sun is on the right side. Cars are fast but can see you from afar

Probably just stay here. The spot is good, there's a bus stop and a gas station. We made a mistake and walked further up, but couldn't find a good position and stuck for a while. Also, there're local city vans that are cheap and go quite far from the city, so you can go out for a better position. Anyway, we ended up in Phuket the same day with a few rides.

Bus stop - Not the best spot, because most of the cars would drive in the main highway, and cars from Samut Sakhon city center heading south would leave at another exit 6 km away.

The first driver dropped me here, and I continued hitchhiking to Samut Songkhram (‡∏™‡∏°‡∏∏‡∏ó‡∏£‡∏™‡∏á‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏°). 40 minutes later I got my second ride out of Bangkok, he took me for 20 km, but still in Samut Sakhon province.
